Nayana is a task manager application designed to help users keep track of their to-dos efficiently. With support for deadlines, events, and to-do lists, Nayana provides a seamless way to organize tasks via a console-based or graphical user interface. She also allows users to categorize tasks and receive reminders for upcoming deadlines, making her an essential tool for improving productivity.
This readme serves as the documentation guide for how to talk to Nayana!
You can add a task with a deadline by specifying the task description and a due date
Got it! I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
You can add an event with a start and end date.
Got it! I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
You can add a simple to-do task without a deadline.
Got it! I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
You can mark a task as done by specifying the task number from the list.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
### 5. Mark a Task as Not Done
You can unmark a task (mark it as not done) by specifying the task number from the list.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
You can delete a task by specifying the task number.
Now you have 2 tasks left in the list.
You can view all the tasks in your list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
You can search for tasks that match a keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Bye!!! Hope to help you again soon!
Nayana gracefully handles errors and provides informative error messages, such as when a task is added without a description or with an invalid date format.
This README.md provides a comprehensive guide on how to use the Nayana task manager.
If you find any errors please let the real Nayana know :)

* Parses user input commands and returns the corresponding {@code Command} object.
* This class is responsible for interpreting various user commands and creating
* the appropriate {@code Command} instances, such as adding, marking, unmarking,
* deleting tasks, or finding tasks based on search criteria.
* The {@code parse} method handles different command types including:

*
  • unmark - Marks a task as not done

*
  • deadline - Adds a task with a deadline

*
  • event - Adds an event task with a start and end date

*
  • todo - Adds a simple task without a deadline

*
  • find - Searches for tasks matching the specified query
* If the command format is invalid or parsing fails, a {@code NayanaException} is thrown.

* Represents a command to add a task.
* This command adds a specified task to the task list, updates the storage,
* and prints a message to the user interface.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the specified task.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Adds the task to the task list, updates the storage, and prints a message.
* @param tasks   The task list to which the task will be added.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage for saving tasks.
* @throws NayanaException If an error occurs while executing the command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NayanaException {
tasks.addTask(task); // Adds the task to the task list.
storage.writeToFile(tasks.getTasks()); // Updates storage with the new list of tasks.
ui.printAddTask(task, tasks.getSize()); // Displays a confirmation message with the current task list size.

* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.

* Executes the delete command by removing the task at the specified index
* from the task list, updating the storage, and printing the task deletion result.

* @param ui      The user interface to print the result.
* @param storage The storage to update with the current list of tasks.
* @throws NayanaException If an error occurs during the execution of the command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NayanaException {
Task task = tasks.delete(index); // Deletes the task to the task list.
storage.writeToFile(tasks.getTasks()); // Updates storage with the new list of tasks.
ui.printDeleteTask(task, tasks.getSize()); // Displays a confirmation message with the current task list size.
